column4: I need some help getting a wireless card working with ndiswrapper.  (Broadcom Corporation BCM4306 802.11b/g Wireless LAN Controller (rev 03))
ndiswrapper looks to be detecting the hardware, but no wireless device has shown up.
what does ndiswrapper -l say
bcmwl5          driver present, hardware present
ok see if you have a eth1
Nope.  eth0 (wired), sit0, lo.
that's what ifconfig -a tells you
Well, I was looking at iwconfig, but same set of three.
ok hmm your sure your doing ifconfig -a right? and not just ifconfig just want to make sure
Yup.
ok try this sudo modprobe ndiswrapper and see what it spits out
No output, no change in ifconfig -a.
Huh?  I'm wired up via eth0 (and IRCing over that).  The wireless works under Windows.  There's a hardware switch, but it appears to be on, based on the LED.
well I was asking that just in case you were on another machine
well if modprobe didn't output anything then it should be working but see if dmesg can see ndiswrapper
Aha...
dmesg gives three error messages from ndiswrapper.
Windows driver is not 32-bit; bad magic: 020B
couldn't prepare driver 'bcmwl5'
and loadndiswrapper failed (65280); check system log for messages from 'loadndisdriver'
guess you need to install 32bit driver
think ndiswrapper doesn't work on x86_64
Should be a 32bit machine.  Can't swear for the driver.
Pulled that from http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=340689&highlight=bcm4306+ndiswrapper
